# Introduction

Meet the Palmer Penguins!!

## Packages

For this analysis we'll use a few packages for visualization and data display.

::: {#import-packages .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns 
from IPython.display import Markdown

sns.set_style('whitegrid')
```
:::


## Data

The dataset we'll use comes from the palmerpenguins package.

::: {#import-load-data .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
from palmerpenguins import load_penguins

penguins = load_penguins()
```
:::


This dataset contains size measurements, clutch observations, and blood isotope ratios for 344 adult foraging Ad√©lie, Chinstrap, and Gentoo penguins observed on islands in the Palmer Archipelago near Palmer Station, Antarctica.[@gorman2014ecological]

![Three species of penguins](images/penguins.png)

Let's take a peek at the data. @tbl-penguins-head shows the first five rows of the `penguins` data frame.

::: {#tbl-penguins-head .cell tbl-cap='First five rows of the penguins data frame.' execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
Markdown(penguins.head().to_markdown(index=False))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3}
| species   | island    |   bill_length_mm |   bill_depth_mm |   flipper_length_mm |   body_mass_g | sex    |   year |
|:----------|:----------|-----------------:|----------------:|--------------------:|--------------:|:-------|-------:|
| Adelie    | Torgersen |             39.1 |            18.7 |                 181 |          3750 | male   |   2007 |
| Adelie    | Torgersen |             39.5 |            17.4 |                 186 |          3800 | female |   2007 |
| Adelie    | Torgersen |             40.3 |            18   |                 195 |          3250 | female |   2007 |
| Adelie    | Torgersen |            nan   |           nan   |                 nan |           nan | nan    |   2007 |
| Adelie    | Torgersen |             36.7 |            19.3 |                 193 |          3450 | female |   2007 |
:::

# Exploratory analysis

## Body mass vs. flipper length

@fig-penguins shows the relationship between body mass and flipper length of penguins.

::: {#cell-fig-penguins .cell execution_count=4}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# from https://github.com/mcnakhaee/palmerpenguins
g = sns.lmplot(x="flipper_length_mm",
               y="body_mass_g",
               hue="species",
               height=7,
               data=penguins,
               palette=['#FF8C00','#159090','#A034F0'])
g.set_xlabels('Flipper Length (mm)')
g.set_ylabels('Body Mass (g)')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![Body mass vs. flipper length of penguins](hello-penguins_files/figure-html/fig-penguins-output-1.png){#fig-penguins width=764 height=662 fig-alt='Body mass vs. flipper length of three species of penguins (Adelie, Gentoo, and Chinstrap) showing a positive relationship between the two variables for each species.'}
:::
:::
